dialogues.text: I knew it..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Happy now? Everyone takes this in. It’s no massive reveal - just a very sad one.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What’s her family said?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (beat) She’s not told them.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: You need to tell her family.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: She’s doesn’t want me to. I promised her. And anyway Gloria says she’s gonna get better. She’s sure of it. And I_ believe her.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Peter! Someone needs to be told and needs to get over here quick! There might be unexpected things to deal with.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'm just telling you what Gloria said that’s all! It’s suddenly charged.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I can’t take this.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ma, she’s not delirious. She knows what she’s saying. Bella begs to differ but doesn’t want to sound insensitive.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: That’s it. Cancel the flights. I’m not going to Australia! Not with Gloria upstairs the way she is.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ma!

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: She needs me here so that’s where I’m gonna be. Not in Australia. Not in bloody Manila. End of story. A visibly upset Bella storms out of the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: You need to sort this lad!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Sort what?!

dialogues.speaker: JOE SNR
dialogues.text: It’s not right Peter son.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s what she wants!

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: What about what Ma wants?!

dialogues.speaker: JOE SNR
dialogues.text: You need to let that girl’s family know.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No I don’t Dad!  63 64 65 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Peter gets up; fixes his brother and father.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And neither will you. * Peter heads out: slams the front door on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand old dame of a theatre in a grand old dame of a city. Peter rushes across towards the Stage Door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rushing to his dressing room followed by OLD JACK, the Stage Manager.

dialogues.speaker: OLD JACK
dialogues.text: You've been pushing it all week Peter. The other lead characters, a (female) Surgeon and * (male) Anaesthetist stand outside their dressing * rooms in a fit of pique.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Actors being late puts everyone into a state of nervous tension!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah well, it’s not on purpose. Someone’s dying at home, OK.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ANAESTHETIST
dialogues.text: Who? Peter deliberates whether to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s a good friend.. * (pause) Gloria Grahame. They look at each other in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: The film star?  67.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANAESTHETIST
dialogues.text: Hah! Peter, darling don’t be silly. We all know film stars don’t die in Liverpool. Peter turns on HIM, right up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Film stars die wherever they fucking end up Geoff. Just like you’re gonna die right here if you don’t shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: (fearful) Sorry old boy.. but the show must go on mustn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m here aren’t I! Peter stares him down, but part of him agrees. The actor’s life.

dialogues.speaker: OLD JACK
dialogues.text: Peter... come on now. Peter retreats into his dressing room to get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter DRESSED as THE NURSE, waiting in the wings. Still fuming. Still confused...

dialogues.speaker: BUT THEN
dialogues.text: As the curtain rises SEE HIM TRANSFORM. The actors escape. He enters stage right and delivers the opening line of the play.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE/PETER
dialogues.text: “Bit of a bleeder wasn't she?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage a SEDATED FEMALE PATIENT is probed by a SURGEON, flanked by THE ANAESTHETIST and THE NURSE.  67 68 68.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE NURSE grabs the patient’s ankles, pushes her knees up, peers up BETWEEN her legs.

dialogues.speaker: THE NURSE
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it! (reading the tattoo) “Sam Was Here”.

dialogues.speaker: THE NURSE
dialogues.text: With a pierced heart.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: But “Sam Was Here?”.. Good God! THEY ALL study the ‘intimate ink’.

dialogues.speaker: THE NURSE
dialogues.text: Maybe he thought she was a tree trunk. THE AUDIENCE ROAR.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: She’s not gonna stick that bloody great big needle in her is she?!

dialogues.speaker: HUSBAND AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: She bloody well is! Peter feels his craft working BIG. Clapping hands clap all they can and we bleed into--

dialogues.speaker: FACIAL EXPRESSIONS FROM ALL THE CAST.
dialogues.text: But most importantly-- PETER ESCAPING HIMSELF.. by doing so ESCAPING GLORIA. INT. LIVERPOOL PLAYHOUSE THEATRE - LATER —- NIGHT 68 House lights. The AUDIENCE CLAP IN RHYTHM (like they do). Peter hits the stage for his curtain call; MASSIVE WHOOPS AND CHEERS - biggest of the night. ON HIS DELIRIOUS FACE as he takes a theatrical bow. + ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI taking Peter home. He looks out on dark, wet Liverpudlian streets. COMING DOWN RAPIDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria, depressed in bed. Tries an APRICOT KERNEL, spits it out. Gets out of bed, sits at the DRESSER, studies HER THINGS, strokes the PENDANT AROUND her neck; flips it open. The tune drifts out... soft, plinky piano. We vaguely recognise it.. Gloria spins on her chair; launches into ‘Ace in the Hole’ from ‘The Naked Alibi’.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (softly singing) “There's con men and there's boosters, Card sharks and crapshooters, Wearing ties and fancy collars..." She stands, following the moves like

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “But where do they get their dollars? They've all got an ace down in the Hole...” THE TEMPO EXPLODES; jazz trumpet takes over. Pan off, lose Gloria in the window: Reflection shot: MARIANNA in ‘NAKED ALIBI’ - wearing a satin cocktail dress with spaghetti straps. She shimmies her way through the ELLA FITZGERALD TRACK.

dialogues.speaker: MARIANNA
dialogues.text: “Fact is their name would be mud, Like a chump playing stud, If they lost that old ace in the hole!!!" Gloria, back in her nightdress stood at the window - slowly shimmying. Looking down onto the street.. IN THE SHADOWS. POV: Peter’s TAXI pulls up.  71 72 73 70. INT. TAXI/EXT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - AT THE SAME 71

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: Peter studies the house.. in particular THE SPARE ROOM. POV: the house in darkness

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (to taxi driver) Mate, changed me mind, take us back to town will you? Belgravia Casino.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI DRIVER
dialogues.text: (studies him) Course mate, money up front... Peter nods, digs in his pockets INT. BELLA’S GUEST ROOM/EXT. STREET - AT THE SAME 72

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: GLORIA’S POV: the internal cab-light showing Peter hand cash up front. BUT he doesn’t open the door. The TAXI then does a three point turn; drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Peter into a late night casino FULL of late night people. Looks relieved as he wanders past the ‘gamers’ gaming - he reaches the bar. Orders a DOUBLE WHISKEY.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Peter!? Reveal EILEEN (31), Peter’s COUSIN in her BLACK CROUPIER DRESS. Peter squeezes her tight.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Soz Eileen, I know you’re working but I need a big drink.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Aunt Bella’s told me Ma.. Gloria’s back at yours? In the spare room?? (pause) What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: HA! Good question!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eileen sees her cousin is acting strange.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: (takes his face) You OK Pete?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Right now? I’m great! Peter shakes his head slowly in despair. Eileen hugs him - she knows him - kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Half an hour then I’m finished..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Debbie! DEBBIE, the barmaid, saunters back over.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peter, my cousin... Whatever he’s ‘avin, put it on the ‘special bill’. DEBBIE nods.. Eileen squeezes his arm, sets off to the tables. Debbie brings Peter a double whiskey - necks it one... he winks at Debbie; she re-fills. INT. BELGRAVIA CLUB - NIGHT —- MOMENTS LATER 74 Peter and Eileen in a quiet corner. Peter MORE than a few scotches in... the high replaced by an inebriated introspection.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’ve got me Ma’ and Da’ and our Joe looking at me asking what the fuckin’ell is going on up there?? (pause) And I don’t know ‘Ei’. It really feels that way. I get a call from Gloria out of the blue and BAM! She’s upstairs looking soo.. Sick.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: D’you know what’s up with her?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Peter KNEW this question was coming. He downs his whiskey - and lets it burn.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Stomach cancer. (pause) I rang the doctor who treated her in Lancaster. He said... Peter can’t quite believe he’s about to say this.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he said she’s gonna die this time... soon.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Two weeks, maybe three.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: (devastated) You're fuckin’ kiddin’ me.. They both sit in silence a moment.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus... pause) She’s had it before then..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (nods ) There’s a scar under here.. (he touches his breast) Only tiny.. I never thought much of it. But now... Thinking back... fuckin’ stupid bastard... Peter thinking back to all sorts.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: What’s she doing in your Ma’s spare room? She should be in a hozzie?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, Gloria doesn’t believe in doctors or hozzies, does she? She hates ‘em. Gloria’s telling me she’s gonna be OK..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH HH + *

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: saying all she needs to do is stay in me Ma’s house a bit longer... rest up... like, the fucking cancer’s gonna disappear.. and then she’s gonna toddle off back theatre in Lancaster.. keep playing Amanda in the Glass ‘bloody’ Menagerie! Like nothing’s happened. That’s Gloria... doesn’t want anyone to know she’s sick.. Not even her kids.. And she’s kissing and hugging me... just like we used to.. And that’s really tough too, coz I love her ‘Ei’. (pause) I fuckin’ love her. Peter can’t stop the tears coming, the booze not helping. Eileen jumps across, takes him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Eh! It’s OK.. Come on... I’m here. She comforts him. He sniffs up, mans up.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Sorry.. I’m OK.. I’m OK.. Eileen knows the only way is to try and lighten things up

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Eh, remember that magical day in New York when I saw yous two. Couldn’t wait to get off that crappy cruise liner I was grafting on. Then only to be welcomed by a movie star! That was soo special! And Gloria soo warm and lovely to me... I loved that day so much I carry the photos round in my bag. (pause) Wanna see ‘em?? Peter thinks.. then nods. Eileen gets the photos out hands them over to Peter whilst coming to stand over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s us! Bloomingdales.. Macy’s. Radio City.. Us on the balcony in her Manhattan apartment, look at those views. (beat) I don’t get it. She doesn’t look ill at all does she? On Peter.. shaking his head in disbelief. ANGLE ON: A photo-snap of Gloria and Peter on the balcony in Manhattan with smiley grins.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 74A EXT/INT. BALCONY/GLORIA’S MANHATTAN APARTMENT - DAY L THE SAME MOMENT. Gloria and Peter tickle each other JUST AFTER Eileen has taken the above holiday snap. The Big Apple looking delicious in the backdrop.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Another one just in-case Eileen gets them to stay still and snaps another.. Gloria takes the camera - she frames-up.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Cheeeeeze!!

dialogues.speaker: PETER/EILEEN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (clenched fists) Everton! !

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Gloria and Peter waving Eileen’s yellow-cab off.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: (out of the window) See you in Liverpool Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Liverpoool, I'm there honey.

dialogues.speaker: EILEEN
dialogues.text: Byeee.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The TAXI drives off.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Crazy girl! I love her! She Reminds me of Bella.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (nods ) Both have a screw loose..

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: All the ‘Turner Crew’ roll like that?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We're ‘Scousers’, so pretty much yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Gloria in a showbiz-y restaurant off Broadway. Gloria takes a slow intake of breath - then with a passionate quiver.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Liverpoooool. (beat) I just wanna go back to.. Liverpoooool.. Say it for me Peter.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Liverpool.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Wow, I’m in love. I miss it..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t. I’m happy right here thanks. Reveal the table lamp-shade has ‘GLORIA GRAHAME’ written on it with stick-on letters, other tables also dedicated to some living HOLLYWOOD LEGEND - LIZA MINELLI, ZSA ZSA GABOR, etc... Peter’s attention drawn to a STAR-BIZZY FLOURISH.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Oh yippee... Liza’s here.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Liza? WE RECOGNISE IT’S LIZA MINELLI

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Liza..

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: She practically lives in here. Gloria sees Peter impressed, her green eyes glow.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kinda person comes to a joint where you’re labeled on the lamp-shade anyway? I don’t know why I brought you here.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Why did you then?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Dunno... Maybe I wanted to impress you.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You.. Impress me? Why?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Because you’re young.. and gorgeous.. and things like that get to me.. even though they shouldn’t and I know it’s wrong. Gloria ceremoniously PICKS THE LETTERS OFF the lamp- shade - twirls it back to Peter.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s better. It now reads: ‘G O HAM’

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Now I’m really impressed, ‘Go Ham’.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Can we just go order pizza back at my place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + ee HH

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They deliver pizza to your apartment??

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: This is America baby... OK. Exit stage left through the kitchens, that way we avoid the flashbulbs out front.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And Liza.. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: But Peter, honey, before we go, you gotta tell me how I look?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Gloria. Honey. You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (pinches his cheek) I’1l take him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You got him! They skip off stage left via the kitchens. EXT. MANHATTAN STREET — MOMENTS LATER Peter, arm round Gloria - strolling Manhattan style.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: OK, this is gonna sound cheezy. You don’t mind me being cheezy for one minute do you?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You kiddin’? My second name’s ‘mozzarella’.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (digs him playfully) Listen!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m listening!

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: OK. Good. (pause) Peter.. I feel so young and alive, and soo.. (visceral squeal) ..-when I’m with you. And I really want to let you know that, it’s important you know. (pause) Cheezy right?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If you mean ‘is that a really lovely thing to say?’ then yes.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: But I mean it!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I was just about to say the same.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Y'know, cheezy stuff..

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Really? Y’don’t think I’m some old maiden getting my kicks out of a handsome young man?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If you are, I’m not complaining... GLORIA STIFFENS, she stares at Peter ice-cold.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Fuck you!! Gloria storms off. Peter knows he’s put his foot in it, goes after her - can’t see these mood swings.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I was kidding! Glo! C’mon! INT. GLORIA’S MANHATTAN APARTMENT - LATER 74E Gloria calmly smoking a cigarette whilst Peter bangs on the front door, locked out. + ee HH FH HH

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Gloria open up! Gloria!!? (pause) “STELLAAAA!" Gloria walks over, opens the door. Peter expecting anger, gets indifference.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Got me figured as some pepped up Blanche Dubois type, huh? (pause) Careful with that... You maybe right. Peter follows her, in she sticks a tape on.. ‘SONG FOR A GUY' by ELTON JOHN drifts softly from a modern early 80’s Hi-Fi unit.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I had to tip the concierge five dollars to even let me in!

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: He owes me ten percent then. Gloria walks onto her balcony. Peter follows.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Anyone told you you look like Lauren Bacall when you smoke?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Yeah.. Humphrey Bogart. I didn’t like it then either. She flicks the cigarette over the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (looks up) All the stars are in sky tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Well.. I guess that’s where they should be. (looking out) I like that thing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: That ‘Chrysler Building’ thing. + ee HH + +

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Peter straightens up, moves in close to her.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You know what I like?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Amuse me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Your face. Gloria - always a sucker for a compliment. Peter goes in for a kiss. Gloria backs her lips just out of reach. She looks at herself in the glass door-- Reflection shot: LAUREL GRAY from ‘IN A LONELY PLACE’.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL GRAY
dialogues.text: “I said I liked your face. I didn't say I wanna kiss it". LAUREL GRAY exits the balcony (in reflection). Stay with GLORIA as she heads across the apartment, reaches the bedroom and removes her blouse, looks back at Peter with obvious eyes then disappears into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lazy sunny day on East Green. Gloria and Peter on a picnic blanket in dark glasses. There’s grape juice and apricot kernels on the go.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The bedroom door unlocks; Gloria enters an apartment void of Peter. Know’s he’s gone. Feels his lack.. 94 95 96 97  97

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She wanders over and sits at her dressing table, looks in the mirror. Then she spots something on the table. THE HEART SHAPED PENDANT - a present from Peter. She picks it up.. her eye-lids heavy with lost love.. looks in the mirror. Reflection shot: LAUREL GRAY from ‘In a Lonely Place’.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREL/GLORIA
dialogues.text: “I lived a few weeks whilst you loved me - goodbye Dix." MOVE IN ON THE LOVE HEART PENDANT as she fixes it AROUND HER NECK, and we--

dialogues.speaker: TRANSITION TO
dialogues.text: INT. STAIRS/BELLA’S KITCHEN - DAWN Back with Gloria CARESSING THE PENDANT as she makes her way downstairs - listening to the argument.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Dry-your eyes lad. She didn’t get in the bleedin’ ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: (pause) They couldn’t get her in Peter. She refused to get in.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: But they said it! The ambulance blokes. They told us! She’s dying! She needs to be in hozzie. She can't stay upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Why not?! Why can’t she?! What if that was your Jessie up there?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Are. You. Fucking. DEAF! Gloria is dying in OUR Mother’s house! (beat) And I’m not gonna let that happen. Hear me lad?? 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + + +e * + ee HH

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love Gloria... but I love me Ma more. And so should fuckin’ you! THEN Gloria appears wraith-like in one of BELLA’S FLOWERY NIGHT-GOWNS. Startles everyone!

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Hey guys.... I can hear you.. (pause) Look at me! I’m OK... Yeah, I’m sick, but I ‘aint gonna die! Joe honey, I ‘aint gonna die. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Oh Gloria, love. Peter! Peter rushes to Gloria’s side.. leads her away. INT. BELLA GUEST ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER 97B Peter settles Gloria back into bed; notes a bottle of DETTOL and cleaning bowl. Opens the window...

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: I missed you tonight, Peter..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I just felt-- I dunno Glo... I’m so sorry..

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (beat) I need my make-up bag Peter. GLORIA looks into the dressing table mirror--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I like the new nightgown.. REFECTION: VIOLET from ‘IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE’.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: “This old thing? Why I only wear it when I don't care how I look." THEY SMILE AT HER MOST FAMOUS LINE OF DIALOGUE. PETER turns to find her bag.. but when he turns back, he notices her eyes are closed again.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Thinking she’s asleep, he creeps out of the room. SUDDENLY she starts coughing.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Am I fighting for my life Peter? Tell me I’m not fighting for my life? Peter agonising.... he sits in and rubs her back.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You’re gonna be just fine Gloria. I’m sure of it.. GLORIA and PETER remain in each other arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back from the PENDANT on a sleeping Gloria.. A weary looking Peter (IN DIFFERENT CLOTHES) notes her erratic breathing. He turns quietly, leaves the room. INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE/HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER 99 Peter picks up the phone; dials the operator.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: United States, California... (reads address book) 6548790, thank you. The line rings out. Then finaly:

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hi! Tim. It’s Peter.. Peter Turner.

dialogues.speaker: TIM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mom’s old friend?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hi... Listen Tim, Gloria’s in Liverpool.. with me... She’s not well Tim.. Drift from Peter having to be dishonest to Gloria, to being deadly honest with Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter finds Bella fixing Gloria’s hair again at the dressing table. Mothering her.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (sees him) We’ve decided Bella can be my Mom too. Peter manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ma, can you help dress Gloria into something warm please.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We’re going out.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Out? Out Where?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s a surprise..

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Don’t be daft, it’s cold out. She needs to stay here where it’s warm.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Come on Ma.. Just a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: (thinks ) No. It’s a stupid idea.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Mum-—

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: -That’s final. Peter searches for Gloria’s eyes. They connect. Gloria senses FUN.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Bella..

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Yes my luv..

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: I kinda like surprises..

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: (beat) Are you sure? (pause) Looks like rain out there.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (smiles at Peter) Yeah.. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: (admits defeat) I’ve got some spare thermals somewhere.. Bella exits to sort. Peter smiling at Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter helps a WRAPPED-UP GLORIA out of a taxi; they take in the impressive Victorian frontage.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Oh my! Isn’t she a beauty! They head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOTH ON THE STAGE looking out onto the EMPTY SEATS. Even this sends shivers down their spines.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They've been treading these boards since 1886.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Gee.. That’s some treading.

dialogues.speaker: JUST THEN
dialogues.text: OLD JACK wanders on with two chairs and a couple of scripts. Plonks the chairs down facing each other, lays the scripts down - and wanders off.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Nice one Jack. Peter helps Gloria over to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: What are you up to?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I thought we’d have some fun.. Peter sits her down, gives her a script. POV: ‘ROMEO AND JULIET’.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me??

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The Bard’s ‘the nuts’ huh.. (sits opposite) I thought we’d try it out. Page 58. Act 1 scene 5. You there? Peter means it. Gloria finds the page.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: I’m there..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Lets.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET/GLORIA
dialogues.text: Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much, Which mannerly devotion shows in this; For saints have hands that pilgrims' hands do touch, And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO/PETER
dialogues.text: Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET/GLORIA
dialogues.text: Ay, pilgrim, lips that they must use in prayer.  102 103 107.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO/PETER
dialogues.text: O, then, dear saint, let lips do what hands do; They pray, grant thou, lest faith turn to despair. For a moment Gloria struggles - the words stick in her throat. Peter unsure what to do - whether to go over - call it a day.. But then--

dialogues.speaker: JULIET/GLORIA
dialogues.text: Saints do not move, though grant for prayers' sake. Peter smiles with pride at his ‘gal’.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO/PETER
dialogues.text: Then move not, while my prayer's effect I take. Thus from my lips, by yours, my sin is purged.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET/GLORIA
dialogues.text: Then have my lips the sin that they have took.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO/PETER
dialogues.text: Sin from thy lips? O trespass sweetly urged! Give me my sin again.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET/GLORIA
dialogues.text: You kiss by the book. PETER rises.. APPROACHES SLOWLY and kisses her softly on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I certainly do. A RIPPLE OF APPLAUSE from the wings where a few Stage- Hands, Old Jack, The Surgeon and The Anaesthetist have congregated without them knowing. Peter bows then helps his LEADING LADY up to curtsy. They both look out to an IMAGINARY FULL HOUSE.. and soak up their standing ovation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria sat in Peter’s arms watching Liverpool’s historic waterfront glide by. His head next to hers protecting her from the wind.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pointing out certain landmarks. He kisses her head lovingly. Gloria smiles through her exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter helping Gloria back to bed - she is asleep before she hits the pillow. Peter tucks her in tight, the sadness returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter taking his curtain call to RAPTUROUS APPLAUSE - a huge smile on his face. Curtain down, he immediately reclaims himself FROM BEING The Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter arriving home - opens the door. A SUITCASE sits in the hallway. An American accent emanates from the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter finds his family gathered with TIM (28) who stands up, offers his hand, he’s good looking, same age-ish as Peter.. taller maybe.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tim. Hi.. we finally meet. Wish it wasn’t this way.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Pete.. Thanks for all you've done for Mom. They manage a smile under the circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (to Bella) How’s she been tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: She’s gotten worse.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I asked your mother to call the doctor.  109.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Peter tries to contain himself.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: That’s only gonna stress her out.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I needed an official note that would allow Mom to travel.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Travel? Travel where?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: There’s a doctor at St. Vincent's New York who Mum trusts. I’ve persuaded her to let him examine her.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: New York!?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: It’s our only chance Peter!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: She can’t get on a plane! The journey will kill her.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: What’s the alternative?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: She goes to hospital.. here. ‘The Liverpool Royal’.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: You've said yourself.. she hates doctors.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Then she stays where she is!

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Here? In your Mom’s house?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yes! She’s comfortable. She’s got me. And my Ma! (to Bella and Joe) Us!  110.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Peter. With all due respect... you're just an ex-boyfriend. This hits Peter hard. THEN SUDDENLY AND SURPRISINGLY--

dialogues.speaker: JOE SNR
dialogues.text: Peter. (pause) Tim's here. And he’s Gloria’s son. (to Tim) And if that’s your decision Tim... (eyeballs Peter) Everyone in this family will support you. Tim nods in appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wrong move. I’m saying now..

dialogues.speaker: JOE SNR
dialogues.text: Lad. It’s not up to you. PETER EYE-BALLS EVERYONE.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: So.. we need to be on the 6.20 flight to Heathrow tomorrow morning, then on to JFK. We need to be leaving here at 4am.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (beat) I’ll get the taxi. I gotta pal that works that time..

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Thank you. (looks around) All of you... For everything. (pause) Please can I use the phone upstairs for final arrangements? Joe Snr nods. Tim leaves. The family sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: JOE SNR
dialogues.text: (to Peter) It’s for the best lad.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joe Snr leaves; just Bella and Peter in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I’1l make some tea. Peter slowly takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looking down on Gloria. Peter enters.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I have to try Peter. I gotta try and save Mom. (pause) I’m just glad she had you to call on. Peter nods solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s a long journey tomorrow. Let me stay with her tonight.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: She’s my responsibility now..

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Tim! (pause) She’s still my girlfriend... (fixes him) Please. Tim gets it.. They emotionally hug. Tim leaves, Peter closes the bedroom door. ALONE... sits close to Gloria - her breathing irregular; skin ghostly grey. Suddenly Gloria moans, groans, gasps in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s OK Glo. I’m here. Don’t fight it. Don’t go on... I’m here now... Let go. A pillow falls to the floor. Peter picks it up - and for a moment there is a flash of the unthinkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + ee HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + ee HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter watches on helpless as Gloria’s deteriorates: Peter moistening her cracked lips; Gloria muttering old lines of dialogue; restlessness; crying in her sleep; her breathing now the dreaded ‘DEATH RATTLE’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK CAB arrives for it’s 4AM pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looking at Gloria - sat in exactly the same position. Has been all night. A knock on the door. Bella comes in.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Taxi’s here. Peter doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peter?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I heard you Ma.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: I’m going to wake Tim. Bella disappears. Peter on a motionless Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Gloria. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gloria... time to go. Gloria's eyes flick open; confusion then she recognises Peter and calms. The overhead light goes on. Bella, Tim, Joe and Joe Snr busy themselves. Tim and Peter help her upright.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Mom I’m going to get you back home. But you have to help me by giving one of your greatest ever performances OK? Is that a deal?  113.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gloria nods.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We can’t send her out like this! She needs make-up. A flurry of energy as Peter applies make-up, brushes her hair, dresses her in her favourite clean cream silk pyjamas, wraps her in a head scarf, plants thick woolen socks fitted on her ‘fat feet’. A white fox fur placed around her shoulders. He loads her dark sun-glasses on last. Tim and Joe get Gloria on her feet, she takes a step then collapses.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to carry her down.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gloria perched on a wooden chair, carried down the stairs by Peter, Tim and Joe. Like removal men shifting a heavy set of drawers. They manage to get her to the bottom. Joe Snr stops the procession - gives Gloria a kiss.. her eyes thank him. THEN BELLA STEPS FORWARD leans in - embraces Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: May the Lord protect you Gloria Grahame.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Don’t forget..

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: What my luv?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: A son needs his Mom... Billy needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella grips her tight, Gloria can’t see her tears.  113 114. EXT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER 113 Gloria loaded into the cab. Peter fixes her seat belt; bends in, kisses her on the lips... trying not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Peter.. how do I look? Peter laughs through his cry.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Beautiful. (pause) Always beautiful Gloria. Gloria manages her SIGNATURE ‘CLUCK’. THEY KISS AS PASSIONATELY AS POSSIBLE...

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me when you land.. I’1l be awake. Tim gets in the cab. Peter summons the strength.. and tears himself away from her arms.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting! Right here!

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (pause) In Liverpoooool. They somehow share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO - the Taxi sets off. It disappears......

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: hoping it’ll come back.. but it doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Eh, knob-head.. Peter snaps to reality. Reveal Joe at the gate. A MOMENT... then Joe walks into the street, takes Peter into his arms; hugs him with all the love he has.  113 114 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PETER struggling to KEEP IT IN

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know... I know.. (pause) Come on Lad. He leads Peter back inside the house. BLOOD BROTHERS. INT. BELLA AND JOE’S HOUSE - AT THE SAME TIME - DAWN 114 Bella and Joe Snr sat at the table.. no words. Lost in Gloria thoughts. Joe enters, hovering by the door.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Is he OK?

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: He’ll be fine, don’t worry. I’1l make sure he’s OK. I’11 make sure for you. Bella smiles. Joe is a ‘Carlsberg’ son... probably the BEST in the world.

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Joe..

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Yes Ma?

dialogues.speaker: BELLA
dialogues.text: Fetch that big suitcase from the basement... me and your Dad need to pack... for Australia. Joe half smiles, relieved.. obediently heads off. Bella reaches for Joe Snr’s hand, he readily clasps it. Life goes on.. and life is Australia, Billy and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters. Breathes in HER presence. Sits on the bed, it’s still warm.. He’s beyond crying, beyond heart break. Then he spots something by his feet. POV: PUBLICITY POSTCARD OF GLORIA FROM ‘THE BAD AND THE BEAUTIFUL’

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It must have dropped from her suitcase in the melee. Peter picks it up... and it’s true--- GLORIA GRAHAME IS TRULY BEAUTIFUL. FOREVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted. The TAXI driving at funeral pace, couriering precious cargo. Gloria somehow shines in the dull overhead cab-light, dressed in cream silk, film-star shades, head scarf, a white fox fur on her shoulders.. ..a tragic goddess from the ‘Silver Screen’.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA ARRIVED IN NEW YORK AND WAS ADMITTED TO ST.
dialogues.text: VINCENT’S HOSPITAL

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND GWENN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “The winner.... Gloria Grahame for ‘The Bad and the Beautiful!'" APPLAUSE from a star-studded crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. ‘RKO THEATRE’ /HOLLYWOOD - REAL FOOTAGE 117

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR CEREMONY
dialogues.text: GLORIA sashays (not entirely gracefully) to the stage. Dress off the peg, hair brushed not styled. Smile fixed. She shakes EDMUND’s hand. Dazed.. as the FAMOUS STATUETTE is placed in her palm.

dialogues.speaker: THEN
dialogues.text: Finds HER AUDIENCE with a subtle, Gloria grin.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: (verbatim) “Thank you... Thank you all very much.” Gloria Grahame exits stage left.
